ygData.messageBody:
nope rooting is cancelled if someone attack with melee weapon (and HIT) i am
nearly sure of that... Just try to root a rat, then pierce him one time then
go back everytime you do it the root is cancelled... I was killed yesterday
by the klik queen cause i root her too close from me and each time i was
casting i was fighting at the same time and hit her (i root her sucessfully
about 6 times and 6 times she continues to move to me). So for me root stop
when someone attack the monster with a melee attack and Hit.

I am going to try this this evening to let you know..

yakos

level 12 wizzard

> Not true. Rooting has a random length it seems. Sometimes the root wears
> off really quickly. Sometimes it will last throughout the entire fight.
> So rooting it works well, as long as it remains intact. Hitting the
> rooted creature, melee, or spellwise, doesn't nullify the rooted effect.
> Cancel Magic does however.
>

> > > > Ways to minimize the hits you do take though, are to travel in a

> > > > thing. When fighting alone here is my suggestion for a strategy..

> > > > kill it before running out mana you win and never get hit.. if you
